title: Ezekiel 7:1
text: MOREOVER the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,

title: Ezekiel 7:2
text: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.

title: Ezekiel 7:3
text: Now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.

title: Ezekiel 7:4
text: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.

title: Ezekiel 7:5
text: Thus saith the Lord GOD; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.

title: Ezekiel 7:6
text: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.

title: Ezekiel 7:7
text: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble is near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.

title: Ezekiel 7:8
text: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.

title: Ezekiel 7:9
text: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations that are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the LORD that smiteth.

title: Ezekiel 7:10
text: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.

title: Ezekiel 7:11
text: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither shall there be wailing for them.

title: Ezekiel 7:12
text: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

title: Ezekiel 7:13
text: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision is touching the whole multitude thereof, which shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.

title: Ezekiel 7:14
text: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.

title: Ezekiel 7:15
text: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.

title: Ezekiel 7:16
text: But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.

title: Ezekiel 7:17
text: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.

title: Ezekiel 7:18
text: They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.

title: Ezekiel 7:19
text: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.

title: Ezekiel 7:20
text: As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations and of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.

title: Ezekiel 7:21
text: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.

title: Ezekiel 7:22
text: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret place: for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.

title: Ezekiel 7:23
text: Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.

title: Ezekiel 7:24
text: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.

title: Ezekiel 7:25
text: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.

title: Ezekiel 7:26
text: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.

title: Ezekiel 7:27
text: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
